The part that is radiated can be imagined to have "disappeared" into a virtual resistance. The dimensions of the radiating element, particularly its length, and its immediate environment, the proximity to ground for instance, affect radiation resistance.  Except for electrically short antennas, radiation resistance makes up most of the antenna impedance.  Antenna efficiency in percentage can be computed as Radiation Resistance over total resistance times 100.
